snippet: Mitt Romney and John McCain, once bitter rivals, said the right words in their appearance in New Hampshire, but body language suggested little warmth between them.
abstract: Political Memo; highly choreographed appearance by Sen John McCain to endorse Mitt Romney's presidential campaign is marked by awkwardness and unspoken coolness between the two men; publicity bid, following Romney's narrow victory at the Iowa caucuses, is further hampered by pointed and critical questions from audience members; Romney's public stiffness and lack of warmth is considered a significant impediment.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and John McCain, once bitter rivals, said the right words in their appearance in New Hampshire, but body language suggested little warmth between them.

headline.main: On Stage, an Awkward Reminder of Personal Rifts in G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: On Stage, an Awkward Reminder of Personal Rifts in G.O.P.
